benchmark_details.name: TableBench
benchmark_details.overview: TableBench is a comprehensive and complex benchmark covering 18 subcategories within four major categories of Table Question Answering (TableQA) abilities. It includes real-world challenges in tabular data interpretation and reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of TableBench is to evaluate a broad spectrum of TableQA capabilities and bridge the gap between academic benchmarks and real-world applications.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark does not extensively explore the inherent complexities of the tables themselves.

data.source: Raw tabular data was collected from existing datasets including WTQ, SQA, TabFact, FeTaQA, and FinQA.
data.annotation: Manual construction and annotation of questions across different categories.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation is based on measuring the n-gram overlap with reference answers.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is assessed based on generation quality and capability to process tabular data.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 shows substantial performance, yet remains below human performance thresholds.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted to evaluate more than 30 LLMs across the reasoning methods.
